newsitem.title: USA: Citicorp, American Express mum on merger rumors.
newsitem.headline: Citicorp, American Express mum on merger rumors.

text.p: American Express Co. stock jumped Friday on rumours that the financial services company and Citicorp had resumed merger talks.

The two New York-based companies declined to comment on the rumours, which pushed American Express stock up $3.875 to $77 in consolidated trading on the New York Stock Exchange. American Express was one of the most actively traded issues on the NYSE, where more than 4.5 million shares changed hands.
"It's our policy not to comment on market speculation or rumours," said an American Express spokeswoman.
"We don't comment on market rumours or speculation," said a Citicorp spokesman.
At Citicorp's annual meeting in April, Chairman John Reed confirmed the two companies had talked but said they had failed to come to an agreement.
Speculation about American Express being sold has focused on a price around $90 a share.
